match.title: 4th ODI
match.statusText: South Africa won by 7 wickets (with 0 balls remaining)

series.name: South Africa tour of West Indies
series.longName: South Africa tour of West Indies

dismissalText.commentary: Shivnarine Chanderpaul c Tsotsobe b McLaren 66 (89b 3x4 0x6) SR: 74.15

dismissalComment.html: end of Chanderpaul, just as he was shifting to a higher gear, he looks to pull a shortish ball but can get it only as far as Tsotsobe at deep midwicket

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gets the yorker right on the third attempt, its spot-on and Pollard's cameo is over, he can't keep that one out and it smashes into the base of legstump, this is one action-packed over

headshotImage.caption: DJG Sammy headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: DJG Sammy headshot

dismissalComment.html: Langeveldt is making a superb comeback after being smashed for 16 off the first three deliveries, Sammy is bowled first ball after he winds up for a big hit only to find the ball has kept lower than he expects, offstump takes a beating, Langeveldt on a hat-trick

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Gayle c Duminy b Morkel 29 (28b 4x4 0x6) SR: 103.57

dismissalComment.html: Morkel gets the breakthrough as he has all series, short of length ball on off, Gayle backed away and looked to strike it over cover but ends up slicing it, its a skier which Duminy gets under from cover to take a well-judged catch

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla c Bernard b Pollard 129 (115b 9x4 2x6) SR: 112.17

dismissalComment.html: that's the end of a superb innings from Amla, a slower ball from Pollard, Amla cracks it towards long-off, Bernard runs in and completes a simple catch, Amla is so tired he can barely trudge off to the dressing room

headshotImage.caption: HM Amla headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: HM Amla headshot

commentPreTextItems.html: Bravo runs in and goes through his bowling action but doesn't let go of the bowl, he starts walking back to his mark

commentTextItems.html: 4-0 to South Africa after a madcap finale, de Villiers swings the final ball to Darren Sammy at midwicket, who fumbles it, takes a few strides to collect it and then misses the stumps from a few yards out as de Villiers scrambles to make his ground, de Villiers isn't celebrating he's just relieved at the victory

commentPostTextItems.html: South Africa extend their winning streak in one-dayers against West Indies to ten, and the Dominican crowd see their team go down for the fourth time in four matches at Windsor Park.

It became a lot closer than South Africa would have liked towards the end, especially after Hashim Amla's controlled hundred and Jacques Kallis' half-century had put them in command. de Villiers and Duminy couldn't find the boundaries for a long spell, and the match could well have ended in West Indies' favour if the Bravo brothers had accepted one of the chances offered to them by Duminy. de Villiers picked off 18 runs off a Pollard over to seemingly settle the issue but three dot balls when one was needed off four took the game to the final delivery.

Gayle: "I'm very disappointed, credit to Bravo for the way he bowled the final over. We got 300, but I felt we were still 30 short given the start we got. Amla's batting also took the game away from us. It's heart-breaking for the fans, such a big turnaround for which I thank the fans. Very disappointing in the middle, too many dot deliveries. Benn didn't have nay injury, we asked him to do a job and he couldn't deliver so it doesn't make any sense. "
Gayle sounded pretty emotional there, used the word 'disappointed' at least six times, and had some very harsh words for Sulieman Benn.
Smith: "Very happy to have chased 300-plus. We were perhaps a bit conservative towards the end, but Hashim was excellent and it good to win."
Hashim Amla is the Man of the Match. "I try and keep the ball on the ground if the game allows it, when the form is good things seem to fall in place."

The final game of the series is on Thursday. Join us then to see whether South Africa can pull off yet another clean-sweep against West Indies. That's it from us for now, good night and thanks for all the mails.

headshotImage.longCaption: AB de Villiers headshot

headshotImage.longCaption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: the crowd goes bonkers as the game heads to the final ball, another wide yorker which de Villiers can't hit
full and very wide, de Villiers thinks it should be called a wide after he fails to reach it, he has a wry grin when the umpire makes no call
fullish ball is driven firmly to Pollard at mid-on, no run taken
appeal for lbw, but that one pitched outside leg, the ball rolls off the pads towards short third man, the scores are now level

commentPreTextItems.html: Dwayne Bravo to bowl the final over

commentTextItems.html: full and wide, de Villiers backs away and drives it towards Gayle at cover
a yorker from Rampaul, de Villiers punches it to mid-off to leave South Africa needing three runs off the final over

headshotImage.caption: AB de Villiers headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: AB de Villiers headshot

headshotImage.caption: JP Duminy headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: JP Duminy headshot

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: de Villiers was in a hurry to finish off the match, charges out of the crease but isn't sure how to play a shortish ball from Rampaul, he swishes at it but misses
down the leg side again, easily helped to fine leg for a single
a low full toss on offstump is driven back to the bowler
a yorker heading down the leg side, de Villiers makes room and chops it towards cover
Duminy now tucks a length ball on middle to deep midwicket for a single
de Villiers remains in imperious form, whipping the final ball of the over to deep midwicket for two more, that's 18 runs off the over

headshotImage.caption: AB de Villiers headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: AB de Villiers headshot

headshotImage.caption: JP Duminy headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: JP Duminy headshot

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: de Villiers brings up another half-century by backing away and crunching the ball over mid-off, that ball lands less than a yard inside the rope
this is a much better delivery, on a length and heading for middle, flicked to deep midwicket for a couple
Pollard bowls this one from very wide, and he sprays it  down the leg side to give away some free runs
de Villiers eases the nerves with a powerful sweep to deep square leg for four, no fielder had a chance of stopping that stroke
Duminy gets off the strike by pushing the ball to extra cover, he's lived a charmed life
another <b>drop</>, this was a far simpler chance at deep midwicket, Duminy mows it straight to Darren Bravo who grasses a sitter
guides the final ball of the over to third man for a single

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Smith b DJ Bravo 23 (29b 2x4 0x6) SR: 79.31

dismissalComment.html: the slower offcutter does the job, what a superb delivery gets rid of Smith, that one turned sharply after pitching outside leg, goes on to beat Smith and hit middle stump, an offspinner will be proud of that delivery

headshotImage.caption: David Bernard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: David Bernard player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla c Bernard b Pollard 129 (115b 9x4 2x6) SR: 112.17

dismissalComment.html: that's the end of a superb innings from Amla, a slower ball from Pollard, Amla cracks it towards long-off, Bernard runs in and completes a simple catch, Amla is so tired he can barely trudge off to the dressing room

dismissalText.commentary: Jacques Kallis c sub (TM Dowlin) b Gayle 51 (54b 1x4 1x6) SR: 94.44

dismissalComment.html: Kallis perishes to the shot he has used so often against the spinners this innings, gets a top-edge as he sweeps and Dowlin takes a smart catch at deep backward square leg to snap the huge partnership

notes: West Indies innings
West Indies: 50 runs in 7.4 overs (47 balls), Extras 1
1st Wicket: 50 runs in 47 balls (DM Richards 23, CH Gayle 26, Ex 1)
Power Play 2: Overs 10.1 - 15.0
Drinks: West Indies - 86/1 in 17.0 overs (DM Richards 43, S Chanderpaul 8)
DM Richards: 50 off 61 balls (6 x 4, 1 x 6)
West Indies: 100 runs in 20.1 overs (122 balls), Extras 6
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 73 balls (DM Richards 26, S Chanderpaul 17, Ex 7)
West Indies: 150 runs in 31.5 overs (193 balls), Extras 9
Drinks: West Indies - 163/2 in 34.0 overs (S Chanderpaul 38, DJ Bravo 28)
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 69 balls (S Chanderpaul 21, DJ Bravo 29, Ex 0)
S Chanderpaul: 50 off 80 balls (1 x 4)
West Indies: 200 runs in 39.3 overs (240 balls), Extras 10
Power Play 3: Overs 44.1 - 49.0
West Indies: 250 runs in 44.5 overs (275 balls), Extras 19
5th Wicket: 50 runs in 38 balls (DM Bravo 30, KA Pollard 20, Ex 3)
West Indies: 300 runs in 49.4 overs (304 balls), Extras 19
Innings Break: West Indies - 303/6 in 50.0 overs (DM Bravo 45, DE Bernard 13)
South Africa innings
South Africa: 50 runs in 8.3 overs (53 balls), Extras 3
1st Wicket: 50 runs in 53 balls (GC Smith 20, HM Amla 28, Ex 3)
Power Play 2: Overs 10.1 - 15.0
HM Amla: 50 off 45 balls (4 x 4, 1 x 6)
Drinks: South Africa - 99/1 in 16.0 overs (HM Amla 51, JH Kallis 21)
South Africa: 100 runs in 16.4 overs (103 balls), Extras 4
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 51 balls (HM Amla 22, JH Kallis 27, Ex 1)
South Africa: 150 runs in 24.5 overs (152 balls), Extras 4
2nd Wicket: 100 runs in 100 balls (HM Amla 53, JH Kallis 46, Ex 1)
JH Kallis: 50 off 52 balls (1 x 4, 1 x 6)
HM Amla: 100 off 94 balls (6 x 4, 1 x 6)
South Africa: 200 runs in 33.6 overs (207 balls), Extras 4
Drinks: South Africa - 213/2 in 35.0 overs (HM Amla 123, AB de Villiers 12)
South Africa: 250 runs in 42.2 overs (257 balls), Extras 6
Power Play 3: Overs 45.1 - 50.0
4th Wicket: 50 runs in 56 balls (AB de Villiers 25, JP Duminy 22, Ex 3)
AB de Villiers: 50 off 55 balls (3 x 4)
South Africa: 300 runs in 48.4 overs (296 balls), Extras 11

stories.title: Benn loses match fee for disobeying Gayle
stories.subTitle: West Indies v South Africa, 4th ODI, Dominica
stories.seoTitle: Benn loses match fee for disobeying Gayle
stories.summary: Sulieman Benn, the West Indies left-arm spinner, has been fined his entire match fee from the fourth ODI against South Africa after he was ordered off the field by his captain Chris Gayle

image.caption: Sulieman Benn celebrates a wicket
image.longCaption: Sulieman Benn celebrates a wicket, West Indies v New Zealand, ICC World Twenty20 warm-up, Guyana, April 28, 2010

stories.title: Losing is becoming a habit - Chris Gayle
stories.subTitle: South Africa in West Indies 2010
stories.seoTitle: Losing is becoming a habit - Chris Gayle
stories.summary: Chris Gayle was disappointed with his side's inability to win games against South Africa, but the West Indies captain was happy with his team's effort and the spirit within the group

image.caption: Chris Gayle and his team struggled to keep Hashim Amla and Jacques Kallis in check
image.longCaption: Chris Gayle and his team struggled to keep Hashim Amla and Jacques Kallis in check, West Indies v South Africa, 4th ODI, Dominica, May 30, 2010

stories.title: Gayle sends Benn from the field
stories.subTitle: West Indies v South Africa, 4th ODI, Dominica
stories.seoTitle: Chris Gayle sends Sulieman Benn from the field
stories.summary: Sulieman Benn has riled opponents and match referees in the past, but he has hit a new low after being asked to leave the field by his captain Chris Gayle

image.caption: Chris Gayle and Sulieman Benn celebrate the wicket of Jacques Kallis
image.longCaption: Chris Gayle and Sulieman Benn celebrate the wicket of Jacques Kallis, West Indies v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Dominica, May 28, 2010

stories.title: Amla century makes it 4-0 for South Africa
stories.subTitle: West Indies v South Africa, 4th ODI, Dominica
stories.seoTitle: Amla century makes it 4-0 for South Africa
stories.summary: Some inept West Indian fielding towards the end, and lack of intensity in pushing for an unlikely win, let them down and it was left to AB de Villiers to steer the more deserving team home

image.caption: Hashim Amla celebrates his second century of the series
image.longCaption: Hashim Amla celebrates his second century of the series, West Indies v South Africa, 4th ODI, Dominica, May 30, 2010

stories.title: Gibson wants batsmen to show 'common sense'
stories.subTitle: South Africa in West Indies 2010
stories.seoTitle: Ottis Gibson wants Windies batsmen to show 'common sense'
stories.summary: A day after Ottis Gibson said he would like a batting coach to be part of his staff, West Indies proved they need the guidance of one by crashing to 157 all out

image.caption: Shivnarine Chanderpaul plays the pull shot during nets
image.longCaption: Shivnarine Chanderpaul plays the pull shot during nets, Roseau, May 27, 2010

stories.title: West Indies hunt for elusive victory
stories.subTitle: West Indies v South Africa, 4th ODI, Dominica
stories.seoTitle: West Indies hunt for elusive victory
stories.summary: While South Africa have clearly been a class apart from their opponents, it is in the batting that the disparity between the two sides has been the greatest

image.caption: Morne Morkel was too hostile for Afghanistan's batsmen
image.longCaption: Morne Morkel was too hostile for Afghanistan's batsmen, Afghanistan v South Africa, ICC World Twenty20, Bridgetown, May 5, 2010

galleries.title: Amla ton gives South Africa 4-0 lead
galleries.subTitle: West Indies v South Africa, 4th ODI, Dominica

image.caption: Dale Richards cuts during his half-century
image.longCaption: Dale Richards cuts during his half-century, West Indies v South Africa, 4th ODI, Dominica, May 30, 2010

recentPreviewStory.subTitle: West Indies v South Africa, 4th ODI, Dominica
recentPreviewStory.seoTitle: West Indies hunt for elusive victory
recentPreviewStory.summary: While South Africa have clearly been a class apart from their opponents, it is in the batting that the disparity between the two sides has been the greatest
